Anime

From Bleach's first Bankai to the depths of isekai. My journey from casual viewer to daily consumer and aspiring creator.

Nothing... happened.

— Roronoa Zoro One Piece, Episode 377

Wake up to reality. Nothing ever goes as planned in this accursed world. The longer you live, the more you realize that only pain, suffering, and futility exist in this reality.

— Madara Uchiha Naruto Shippuden, Episode 344

A lesson without pain is meaningless. For you cannot gain anything without sacrificing something first. But once you have recovered from the pain and overcome it, you will find that you have a heart strong enough to overcome any obstacle.

— Roy Mustang Fullmetal Alchemist: Brotherhood, Episode 50

I'll leave tomorrow's problems to tomorrow's me.

— Saitama One-Punch Man, Episode 5

I don't know the answer. I never have. Whether I trusted myself or the choices of my dependable comrades, there was no way to know the outcome. So… choose for yourself whichever decision you will regret the least.

— Levi Ackerman Attack on Titan, Episode 54

My Journey

The Beginning

My journey began in junior secondary school, fueled by the passionate discussions of my roommates. I took the plunge with Bleach, completely unaware of the massive world I was stepping into. The hook was set deep the first time Ichigo unleashed his Bankai. The sheer scale, the power shift, the visual spectacle it was a defining “I get it now” moment that transformed me from a curious observer into a dedicated fan.

The Deep Dive

From there, I dove headfirst into the world of light novels and isekai. Overlord was my gateway drug. It wasn’t just about the power fantasy; it was the adventure, the freedom to shape a world, the stunning beauty of its scenes, and the philosophical question of what one does with absolute power.

The Daily Ritual

Now, I’m a daily consumer. My ritual is built on the mental patience to wait a week for a new episode, filled by restarting old favorites to catch missed plots and hunting for hidden gems. Anime is my companion for meals, my rest after work, and my perfect distraction. I’ve reached that point where it feels like there’s no isekai left unseen.

The Builder’s Vision

This deep dive has made the industry’s pain points painfully clear. I’ve spent hours, like searching for the psychological sports masterpiece One Outs, only to find it tucked away on an obscure YouTube channel. Keeping up with seasonal releases is a part time job, and there’s no easy way to share the experience to see what my friends are watching or to build a shared watchlist.

This frustration is where my passion for anime meets my skills as a builder. I see a world where better tools can make being a fan seamless and more social. My goal is to build that world.

Fun Facts

🎬

Demon Slayer: Infinity Castle Breaks Records

Records

Demon Slayer: Infinity Castle has become the highest-grossing anime film of all time, surpassing the previous record held by Mugen Train and breaking Japan's all-time box office records with unprecedented success.

📚

One Piece: The Anime That Never Ends

Records

With over 1,100 chapters and 500 million copies sold, One Piece holds the Guinness World Record as the best-selling manga series by a single author. Creator Eiichiro Oda has been writing it for over 25 years!

🗾

Anime Tourism is a $2.4 Billion Industry

Impact

Anime-inspired tourism generates billions for Japan's economy. Cities featured in popular anime see visitor increases of 30-300%, with fans making pilgrimages to real-world locations from their favorite shows.

🎤

Voice Actors Are Japan's Hidden Superstars

Industry

Japanese voice actors (seiyuu) have massive celebrity status with sold-out concerts, fan clubs, and endorsement deals. Top seiyuu like Kana Hanazawa and Mamoru Miyano earn millions and have dedicated fan followings rivaling pop stars.

🌟 Easy Mode

In 'Bleach', what is the name of Ichigo's Zanpakutō that he first unleashes as a Bankai?

Tensa Zangetsu is the name of his Bankai, manifesting as a sleek, black-bladed katana.

Which of these is NOT a common isekai trope?

While music anime exist, it's not a standard trope for the isekai (another world) genre.

What is the core alchemical principle in 'Fullmetal Alchemist'?

Equivalent Exchange is the fundamental law: to obtain, something of equal value must be lost.

In 'Bleach', what is the name of Ichigo's Zanpakutō that he first unleashes as a Bankai?

Tensa Zangetsu is the name of his Bankai, manifesting as a sleek, black-bladed katana.

Which of these is NOT a common isekai trope?

While music anime exist, it's not a standard trope for the isekai (another world) genre.

What is the core alchemical principle in 'Fullmetal Alchemist'?

Equivalent Exchange is the fundamental law: to obtain, something of equal value must be lost.

Which Studio Ghibli film was the first to win an Academy Award?

Spirited Away won the Academy Award for Best Animated Feature in 2003, making it the first anime film to win an Oscar.

In Attack on Titan, what is the name of the military branch that fights Titans outside the walls?

The Survey Corps (Scouting Legion) is the branch that ventures beyond the walls to fight Titans and explore the outside world.
